name: Sweet Potato Crunch
author: bakerbaker
summary: This is a fun and yummy dish for Thanksgiving. People who don't eat sweet potatoes usually love it!
directions: Place sweet potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 20 to 30 minutes
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Mash sweet potatoes, 1/3 cup butter, and white sugar together in a bowl
Beat milk, eggs, and vanilla extract into sweet potato mixture using an electric mixer until smooth; pour 1/2 the mixture into a 9x13-inch casserole dish
Mix brown sugar, coconut, pecans, and flour together in a bowl; stir in 3 tablespoons butter until evenly coated
Sprinkle 1/2 the topping over sweet potato mixture
Pour remaining sweet potato mixture over topping and sprinkle with remaining topping
Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and topping is lightly browned, about 1 hour
